tests/BaseTest.py

00001 #! /usr/bin/env python
00002 
00003 """This is the baseTest from which all tests inherit. 
00004 
00005 The BaseTest handles initialization of the form
00006     BaseTest( potentialname, element symbol, TestDependencies List, others)
00007  """
00008 
00009 #standard imports
00010 import sys
00011 import ase
00012 import argparse
00013 
00014 #import xml library
00015 import xml.dom.minidom as mini
00016 
00017 def getContent(node):
00018     rc = []
00019     for child in node.childNodes:
00020         if child.nodeType == child.TEXT_NODE:
00021             rc.append(child.data)
00022     return ''.join(rc)
00023 
00024 def XMLReader(xmltext):
00025     """This method unpacks results to a dictionary"""
00026     from xml.parsers.expat import ExpatError
00027     try:
00028         doc = mini.parseString(xmltext)
00029     except ExpatError:
00030         assert False
00031     configs = {}
00032     results = {}
00033     testnode = doc.documentElement
00034     try:
00035         confignode = testnode.getElementsByTagName('config')[0]
00036         for child in confignode.childNodes:
00037             if child.nodeType == child.ELEMENT_NODE:
00038                 configs[child.tagName] = getContent(child)
00039 
00040         resultnode = testnode.getElementsByTagName('results')[0]
00041         for child in resultnode.childNodes:
00042             if child.nodeType == child.ELEMENT_NODE:
00043                 results[child.tagName] = getContent(child)
00044     except IndexError:
00045         assert False
00046     return configs, results
00047 
00048 class BaseTest:
00049     """This is the Base Test from which all other Tests inherit."""
00050     
00051     def __init__(self,potentialname,element,TestDependencies=[],verified=False,verify=False,write=False,*args,**kwargs):
00052         self.potentialname = potentialname
00053         self.potential = self.getASEPotentialByName(potentialname)
00054         self.element = element
00055         self.verify = verify
00056         self.write = write
00057         
00058         self.TestDependencies = TestDependencies
00059 
00060     def RequireTest(self,testname):
00061         import os
00062         requirepath = '../bin/require.py'
00063         p = os.popen('python ' + requirepath + ' ' + self.potentialname + ' ' + self.element + ' ' + testname)
00064         xml = ''.join(p.readlines())
00065         p.close()
00066         configs, results = XMLReader(xml)
00067         return results
00068 
00069     def XMLWriter(self,resultsdict):
00070         """This method packages the results dictionary into our standard XML 
00071         Format.  The layout is roughly as follows
00072         
00073         <test id='TestName'>
00074             <config>
00075                 <potential> PotentialName </potential>
00076                 <element> Element Symbol </element>
00077             </config>
00078             <results>
00079                 <FirstResultKey> FirstResultValue </FirstResultKey>
00080                 <SecondResultKey> SecondResultValue </SecondResultKey>
00081                 ...
00082             </results>
00083         </test>
00084         """
00085     
00086         #create the XML document
00087         doc = mini.Document()
00088         
00089         #Create and append the main test node
00090         testnode = doc.createElement('test')
00091         testnode.setAttribute('id',str(self.__class__.__name__))
00092         doc.appendChild(testnode)
00093         
00094         #Set the configuration part
00095         confignode = doc.createElement('config')
00096         testnode.appendChild(confignode)
00097         
00098         #set and append the potential name and element nodes
00099         potentialnode = doc.createElement('potential')
00100         elementnode = doc.createElement('element')
00101         confignode.appendChild(potentialnode)
00102         confignode.appendChild(elementnode)
00103         
00104         potentialnode.appendChild(doc.createTextNode(str(self.potentialname)))
00105         elementnode.appendChild(doc.createTextNode(str(self.element)))
00106         
00107         #if there are test dependencies, add them
00108         if self.TestDependencies:
00109             testdependenciesnode = doc.createElement('testdependencies')
00110             confignode.appendChild(testdependenciesnode)
00111             confignode.appendChild(doc.createTextNode(str(self.TestDependencies)))
00112         
00113         #creates and appends the result node
00114         resultsnode = doc.createElement('results')
00115         testnode.appendChild(resultsnode)
00116         
00117         #for every key,value pair in the results dictionary, create and
00118         #append a new node.
00119         for key,value in resultsdict.iteritems():
00120             resultnode = doc.createElement(key)
00121             resultnode.appendChild(doc.createTextNode(str(value)))
00122             resultsnode.appendChild(resultnode)
00123         
00124         
00125         if self.write:
00126             resultfile = '../results/' + self.__class__.__name__ + '.' + self.potentialname + '.' + self.element + '.xml'
00127             outputfile = open(resultfile,'w')
00128             outputfile.write(doc.toxml())
00129             outputfile.close()
00130             
00131         #return a pretty xml string.
00132         return doc.toxml()
00133         
00134 
00135     def getASEPotentialByName(self,name):
00136         """A little helper method to call ASE potentials by name. 
00137         
00138         In the future, to be extended to include KIM potentials"""
00139         calculatorName = 'ase.calculators.' + name + '()'
00140         if name == "GPAW":
00141             from gpaw.aseinterface import GPAW
00142             return GPAW(h=0.2, kpts = (4,4,4), nbands = 15)
00143         if name == "ASAP":
00144             from asap3 import EMT
00145             return EMT()
00146         return eval(calculatorName)
00147         
00148     def TestResults(self):
00149         """The Test Results method, runs the test and packages the result in a dictionary"""
00150         raise LackingTestResults
00151         return {}
00152 
00153     def Verify(self):
00154         """Optional verify method, creates an easy to check visual verification of test results"""
00155         raise LackingVerify
00156         pass
00157         
00158     def main(self):
00159         """Main is called when the Test is run from the command line. currently runs tests
00160         and passes the dictionary of results to the XMLWriter Method"""
00161         if self.verify:
00162             self.Verify()
00163         return self.XMLWriter(self.TestResults())
00164         
00165         
00166 #Parser specification
00167 
00168 parser = argparse.ArgumentParser()
00169 parser.add_argument('potential',nargs='?', help='The first argument is the potential')
00170 parser.add_argument('element',nargs='?', help='The second argument is the element')
00171 parser.add_argument('TestDependencies',nargs='*', help='Remaining nontagged arguments are test dependencies')
00172 parser.add_argument('-v','--verify', action='store_true', help='runs the verify method')
00173 parser.add_argument('-w','--write', action='store_true', help='writes the xml file to the results directory')
00174 
00175 args = parser.parse_args()
